Hi everyone. I am sitting next to my office/work/school computer and trying to do my dissertation work. But, as usual when i write some academic paper, i look for distraction. So, here i am

I found KSP about two months ago. I started with fun in sandbox. Crashes to Mun, sending pore kerbals to Kerbol... But from 0.23 i do serious space science (no more killing kerbal, only probes). As scientist i really like it, but i want more MOOOREEE. So, can you recommend me some mods that add more science?

Hello Eskalante. Science is a pretty new addition to this developing game, so I'm not aware of any mods that amplify that aspect of play. There are some which alter the existing system in one way or another, but I don't think any expand it.

I'm not aware of any mods that amplify that aspect of play. There are some which alter the existing system in one way or another, but I don't think any expand it.

There are quite a few that expand the game. The first that comes to mind is Kethane. (Mining, resources). There are satellite mapping mods, realistic mods like life support and deadly re-entry, all the way up to actual multiplayer mods.

Check out Kerbal Space Port. You will find everything you need there.

There are quite a few that expand the game.
Eskalante is asking specifically for things that give him more science activities.

KSP Interstellar mod adds some new science instruments, I think. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43839-0-23-KSP-Interstellar-(Tweakables-New-ISRU-Preecoolers)-Version-0-9-2-(Beta)

There's also mods that add new science messages.

Thanks everyone for tips. I found isa mapsat mod. It is exactly what i wanted I really like the idea that you get something useful from research, with this i can scan eve for big flat land for spaceplane landing.
